entry.title: o night, divine
entry.summary:
Author: Surakian

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,976Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 32

Summary: Eddie stares at Buck with his eyebrows furrowed in nervousness, but there is also that same softness present that had been on Eddie’s face earlier—like all of the love in Eddie couldn’t be contained and so it was shining from his eyes. He steps close to Buck then holds the mistletoe over Buck’s head. “Eddie?” Buck sits the towel down. “It’s tradition, right?” Eddie gives Buck a small smile as he places a hand on Buck’s shoulder, his grip gentle yet solid—what should feel grounding instead makes Buck feel like he’s floating. “Yeah, tradition.”A Buddie Mistletoe fic. 3x10 fix-it

entry.title: Nothing is Safe in the Quiet
entry.summary:
Author: toastylamp

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,552Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 204

Summary: “Tommy, fucking answer me!” He was yelling now, swiping his free hand nervously over his hair. He feels the urge to hit something. Someone. He wants to punch and punch and punch until his knuckles bleed out because it means he can still feel something. “Evan is going to need you, you know,” Tommy says quietly. Eddie can hear sobs in the background. Now what the fuck is that supposed to mean? “What happened to Bobby?” Eddie’s voice breaks. “Where is he?” Tommy exhales like it hurts. “Bobby Nash is dead.” It hits Eddie like a bag of bricks to his stomach. His knees weaken, his ears ring, and for a second, everything goes white. When he returns to reality, Tommy’s voice calls his name on the phone. He swipes at his face, breath shaky. “Tell Buck I’m on the next flight out.” He hangs up.   Or: Eddie Diaz is trying to have a quiet movie night with his son when the phone rings. It’s Tommy Kinard—and he’s saying Bobby Nash is dead. Everything spirals after that. 12/9/25 - after months I finally updated!

entry.title: Nobody's Son
entry.summary:
Author: funnyfeelingbuckley

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,319Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 112

Summary: Buck’s phone starts ringing in his pocket. He sighs and checks the caller ID, staring in confusion at the unfamiliar number. “Uh, hello?” “Hello there, is this Evan Buckley?” A woman’s voice is heard through the phone. “May I ask who’s calling?” “My name is Hope Williams, from Child Protective Services. I was wondering if you had a moment to schedule a meeting on behalf of Charlotte Davis?” “I-I’m sorry, I think you must have called the wrong Evan Buckley. Who is Charlotte Davis?”   Or Buck finds out he has a 7-year-old daughter. Buck finds out a lot of stuff, actually. Title based on the Sabrina Carpenter song

entry.title: Backdraft
entry.summary:
Author: ghostiessssss

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,343Chapters: 1/8Kudos: 2

Summary: “Evan Buckley, are you even listening to me?” He wasn’t. He was looking at his shoes, the words going through one ear and going out the other. Through the yelling and crying, he could hear the sounds of cameras flashing and paparazzi catcalling outside. Having this conversation in a room with windows was a bad idea. He closed the curtains and looked at Margaret and Phillip, who was staring down at him with anger. The phone that Phillip held showed an article from 10 hours ago, titled ‘Manwhore of Hollywood?! Evan Buckley and his harem of women!’. The article showed a collage of paparazzi photos that had been taken at various parties and clubs, with about a dozen different women at his side. Pretty damning evidence that Evan Buckley was a ‘Manwhore’, indeed. +++ In which Buck is a former child star and Eddie is the one guy that doesn't know who he is.

entry.title: Things We Don't Say
entry.summary:
Author: Ifallinlovewithfictionalboys

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 137,127Chapters: 20/23Kudos: 78

Summary: “What are you doing? You have to keep moving.”   “I never told you I’m from LA.”   Dr. Sol’s eyes widen, and he takes a step back.   “Howard–”   “Don’t.” He lets out an animaltic growl, “Don’t say anything unless it’s to explain what the hell is going on and why there is a Korean gang looking for me.”   “Mafia.” Dr. Sol corrects, “I don’t know what they want from you, I just know of them. Now please, you must go back to L.A. Your pack needs you.”  ---After seven months of being presumed dead, Buck comes back and finally reunites with his family.Now that he’s back, Buck makes it his mission to change things along the way. It’s easier than ever now that his pack knows the truth — or so he thought. Apparently, a supernatural world can make a world of a difference, and new threats are coming out of the shadows.It doesn’t help that he feels like he’s constantly forgetting something, or that Chimney is hiding secrets of his own.—PLEASE NOTE: This is part of a series, and will likely not make any sense as a stand alone.

entry.title: there won't be a single place dark or unhappy
entry.summary:
Author: wylanvanecks

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,583Chapters: 4/32Kudos: 56

Summary: A week before he was set to go to Vermont, Buck did in fact find out. He woke up to the giant groupchat—composed of the 118, their spouses, and the kids old enough to have phones—going crazy with a random flurry of pictures, all sent by different people. A winter coat here, a sled there, snow boots and gloves and scarves and plane tickets—Wait. Plane tickets? Then, a text with actual words. Christopher: cancel ur air bnb buck. we found something better. OR The 118 and their families take a Christmas vacation!

entry.title: duet and detonate
entry.summary:
Author: jilyandco

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,091Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 6

Summary: When the firehouse heats up, the stage gets hotter. Buck and Eddie have faced burning buildings, impossible rescues, and every chaos 911 could throw at them. But nothing prepared them for karaoke night. One’s all energy, theatrics, and glitter; the other’s trying to survive without tripping over a microphone stand. As rival duos, unexpected mishaps, and ridiculous costumes collide, the sparks between them become impossible to ignore. Between high notes, stolen glances, and dangerously close shoulder brushes, Buck and Eddie are about to learn that the hardest thing isn’t hitting the perfect harmony. It's admitting the song they’re really singing is one of desire, laughter, and maybe, just maybe, love.

entry.title: (you're) having my baby
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,026Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 16

Summary: Eddie knows this method is… unorthodox, to say the least. But as the options for surrogates narrowed and the prices for implantation went up, it started to seem less and less crazy. Maddie had already agreed to donate her eggs so that their baby could be as close in DNA to both Buck and Eddie as possible. And Eddie isn’t exactly a straight guy, given the whole ‘married to a man’ thing, but they know he can get someone pregnant– even when he shouldn’t. And Buck and Maddie… they haven’t always had the most normal of sibling relationships.It all just… worked out. It may not be normal, but it works for all of them. Chim included, if the way he’s looking at Eddie now is any indication.or,Buddie wants to have a baby. Madney are happy to help

entry.title: the one who drives you home tonight
entry.summary:
Author: perlaret

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,568Chapters: 8/25Kudos: 96

Summary: Eddie should be there. But he’s not. And if he can’t be, then… “It’s me,” Buck says, his voice cracking over the words.The one where Eddie goes missing and presumed dead, but make it an advent calendar challenge. A collection of scenes delving into what the consequences of Eddie's will might look like in Season 9.
